title: Minuteman Missile National Historic Site: Online References
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     Research     Bibliography     Online References                  Books Documents References       Historic Resource Study - The Missile Plains: Frontline of America's Cold War - 2003  The premier historical reference work on the construction, installation, operation and deactivation of Minuteman Missiles in western South Dakota. Provides historical context to Intercontinental Ballistic Missile development during the Cold War. Also, takes an in-depth look at the establishment of Minuteman Missile National Historic Site.  Minuteman Missile Special Resource Study - 1995 A link to the first document produced in the development of the park. This publication helped lead to the establishment of Minuteman Missile National Historic Site. It includes a highly readable history of Intercontinental Ballistic Missile development during the 1950's and early 1960's that led to the creation of the Minuteman weapons system. The document does an outstanding job of placing the Minuteman weapons system within the historical context of the early years of the Cold War.  Association of Air Force Missileers Newsletter Library - 1993 to Present Every issue of the quarterly newsletter of the Association of Air Force Missileers can be found in this online library. These newsletters contain articles about the history and experiences of those who worked in, around and with the many different types of missile systems deployed by the United States Air Force.
